title.narrative: 1.3 COMMUNITY BASED HEALTH AND NUTRITION

description.narrative: 1.3 Community-based health and nutrition interventions are better institutionalized in the health system., which contributes to Early Detection And Treatment Of Malnutrition, Fast-Track The End Of Hiv/Aids, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, more children (aged 0â€“18) and women benefit from quality comprehensive health and nutrition services and practices.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.3 Community-based health and nutrition interventions are better institutionalized in the health system.

description.narrative: Sierra Leone launched a revised Community Health Worker (CHW) policy with UNICEF support and committed to institutionalizing a more efficient, effective and equitable national CHW programme. Operationalization of the policy started with recruitment of 8,625 CHWs nationwide, development of revised training guides and tools, and training of 933 trainers, who will roll out CHW training. While in transition, the previous cohort of CHWs continued to deliver essential community health and nutrition services, conducting 105,910 antenatal and 124,642 postnatal household visits, tracing 18,871 children who defaulted from immunization programmes, and treating 108,737 children with malaria, pneumonia and diarrhea in 2021. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/02/2022
